terminologie_extrait.definition: The thinnest part of the wrist lines up with the racket.
terminologie_extrait.contexte: For shakehand players, a neutral grip means the thinnest part of the wrist lines up with the racket.

grip-and-stance.diagnostic: Twists the entire body out of proper alignment, causing technique problems.

debutant.description: Use a neutral grip and proper stance during formative years, and usually well beyond that.

intermediaire.description: Adjust the foot positioning and racket angle to a neutral position.

avance.description: Adjust the grip and foot positioning to optimize stroke technique.

exercices_complementaires.description: Hold a piece of paper and twist the top or bottom to demonstrate the effects of bad grip or foot positioning.

erreurs_a_eviter.pitfall: Forcing the arm or wrist to adjust for a bad grip, leading to awkward strokes and timing issues.
Not recognizing the cause of technique problems and treating only the symptoms instead.
